intro: Gompholobium tenue, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burr荆棘, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gompholobium tenue plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
